title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch national security satellite for NRO on Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: The mission will be the fifth of 2025 featuring spacecraft developed by the National Reconnaissance Office. Liftoff of the NROL-69 mission from pad 40 is set for 1:48 p.m. EDT (1748 UTC).

title: MaiaSpace signs first commercial launch contract
summary:
MaiaSpace, a small launch vehicle developer spun out of ArianeGroup, has signed its first commercial launch contract for missions launching as soon as 2027.
The post MaiaSpace signs first commercial launch contract appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Shenzhou-19 astronauts complete third spacewalk, install final debris shielding on Tiangong
summary:

title: Pangea Aerospace raises Series A round to fund space propulsion work
summary:
Spanish propulsion startup Pangea Aerospace has raised 23 million euros ($25 million) to further development of advanced rocket engines for use in launch vehicles and spacecraft.
The post Pangea Aerospace raises Series A round to fund space propulsion work appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: 60 Years Ago: Gemini III, America’s First Two-Person Flight
summary: On March 23, 1965, the United States launched the Gemini III spacecraft with astronauts Virgil “Gus” Grissom and John Young aboard, America’s first two-person spaceflight. Grissom earned the honor as the first person to enter space twice and Young as the first member of the second group of astronauts to fly in space. During their […]

title: After Delays, ESA to Publish Launcher Challenge Call Next Week
summary:
During a press briefing following the 332nd ESA Council meeting, ESA Director General Josef Aschbacher announced that the agency will publish a call for proposals for the European Launcher Challenge in the coming week. Announced in November 2023, the European Launcher Challenge is intended to support the development of sovereign launch capabilities and, ultimately, a […]
